title: How to Tile a Picture in Microsoft Word

steps.title: Open the Word document in which you want to tile a picture.
steps.content: Open the Word document in which you want to tile a picture.

steps.title: Click on “Page Layout” or “Design,” then click on “Page Color.
steps.content: Click on “Page Layout” or “Design,” then click on “Page Color. ”

steps.title: Click on “Fill Effects.
steps.content: Click on “Fill Effects. ” This opens the Fill Effects menu.

steps.title: Click on the “Picture” tab, then click “Select Picture.
steps.content: Click on the “Picture” tab, then click “Select Picture. ” [1] X Research source

steps.title: Select the picture or image you want tiled, then click “Insert.
steps.content: Select the picture or image you want tiled, then click “Insert. ” The image will appear in the preview pane of your document.

steps.title: Click “OK.
steps.content: Click “OK. ” Your picture will now be tiled in the background of your Word document.

steps.title: Drag the “Zoom” slider button to the left or right to resize the tiles as desired.
steps.content: Drag the “Zoom” slider button to the left or right to resize the tiles as desired.

steps.title: Click on “File” and select “Options.
steps.content: Click on “File” and select “Options. ” This opens the Word Options window.

steps.title: Click on “Display” in the left pane of Word Options.
steps.content: Click on “Display” in the left pane of Word Options.

steps.title: Place a checkmark next to “Print background colors and images,” then click “OK.
steps.content: Place a checkmark next to “Print background colors and images,” then click “OK. ” Your picture is now tiled in the background and will print in the background of your Word document.
